thread.title: Nonprofits Are Quietly Keeping New York’s Commercial Property Sales Market Afloat

author: Keiko Morris
title: Nonprofits Are Quietly Keeping New York’s Commercial Property Sales Market Afloat
text:
Big financial firms got much of the attention in New York’s commercial real estate circles last year by inking large deals for the city’s flashy new office space. But the more frugal sector of nonprofit and public organizations carved out an important role as well, signing huge leases of their own and helping to prop up an otherwise slumping commercial property sales market.
Last year, nonprofit and public organizations signed leases for 6 million square feet of space throughout the city, a 46.3% increase from 2016, according... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
